/devxxxx/clockbase.Description: Provides clockbase value for the device

/devxxxx/system/extclk.Description: Boolean value switching from internal to external clock., When using external clock, make sure that a clock generator is connected to the Clock In connector.

/devxxxx/system/syncenable.Description: Boolean value enabling multi-device timestamp synchronization over ZSync., When synchronizing timestamps between devices make sure that an appropriate cable is connected between the ZSync ports of the leader and follower devices.

/devxxxx/system/syncreset.Description: Boolean value activating timestamp reset over ZSync., When synchronizing timestamps between devices make sure that an appropriate cable is connected between the ZSync ports of the leader and follower devices.

/devxxxx/system/synctime.Description: The timestamp to load when timestamp reset is activated.

/devxxxx/system/activeinterface.Description: Node providing the active interface of the device.

/devxxxx/system/properties/minfreq.Description: Minimum oscillator frequency of the device.

/devxxxx/system/properties/maxfreq.Description: Maximum oscillator frequency of the device.

/devxxxx/system/properties/mintimeconsta.Description: Minimum filter time constant of the device.

/devxxxx/system/properties/maxtimeconsta.Description: Maximum filter time constant of the device.

/devxxxx/features/serial.Description: Node providing the serial number of the device.

/devxxxx/features/devtype.Description: Node providing a string about the type of device.

/devxxxx/features/options.Description: Node giving information on enabled options., Reading this node returns a string containing a newline-separated list of all installed options.

/devxxxx/features/code.Description: Node providing a mechanism to write feature codes.

/devxxxx/status/flags/binary.Description: A binary representation of all flags., When multiple flags are set the values are or-ed.

/devxxxx/status/flags/plllock.Description: Flag indicating if the internal PLL for clock generation has locked.

/devxxxx/status/flags/dcmlock.Description: Flag indicating if the internal digital clock manager (DCM) has locked.

/devxxxx/status/flags/fx2rx.Description: Flag indicating if the device receives data via USB.

/devxxxx/status/flags/pkgloss.Description: Flag indicating that the device lost data when sending via USB.

/devxxxx/status/flags/mixerclip/n.Description: Flag indicating that this mixer-channel is clipping.

/devxxxx/status/flags/adcclip/n.Description: Flag indicating that this ADC-channel is clipping.

/devxxxx/status/flags/scopeskipped.Description: Flag indicating that scope data has been skipped., This happens when too much data is being sent over USB.

/devxxxx/status/flags/demodsampleloss.Description: Flag indicating that demodulator data has been lost.

/devxxxx/status/adc0min.Description: The minimum value on Signal Input 1 (ADC0) during 100 ms.

/devxxxx/status/adc0max.Description: The maximum value on Signal Input 1 (ADC0) during 100 ms.

/devxxxx/status/adc1min.Description: The minimum value on Signal Input 2 (ADC1) during 100 ms.

/devxxxx/status/adc1max.Description: The maximum value on Signal Input 2 (ADC1) during 100 ms.

/devxxxx/status/echowrite.Description: 32 bits written to this node will be echoed back via ECHOREAD node.

/devxxxx/status/echoread.Description: 32 bits written to ECHOWRITE node are echoed here.

/devxxxx/stats/bytessent.Description: Total amount of bytes sent via USB.

/devxxxx/stats/bytesreceived.Description: Total amount of bytes received via USB.

/devxxxx/stats/physical/1v2.Description: Actual voltage of the 1.2 Volts supply.

/devxxxx/stats/physical/1v8.Description: Actual voltage of the 1.8 Volts supply.

/devxxxx/stats/physical/2v5.Description: Actual voltage of the 2.5 Volts supply.

/devxxxx/stats/physical/3v3.Description: Actual voltage of the 3.3 Volts supply.

/devxxxx/stats/physical/5v0.Description: Actual voltage of the 5.0 Volts supply.

/devxxxx/stats/physical/overtemperature.Description: Too high FPGA temperature detected during session.

/devxxxx/raw/read/request.Description: write a length into this node and the register will be read.

/devxxxx/raw/properties/timeconstant.Description: Time constant of the device used for testing.

/devxxxx/demods/n/adcselect.Description: Selects the index of the signal input for the demodulator.

/devxxxx/demods/n/order.Description: Selects the order of the low-pass filter.

/devxxxx/demods/n/timeconstant.Description: Sets the time constant of the low-pass filter., The time constant is set for each stage of the low-pass filter. The total time constant and bandwidth depends on the selected order.

/devxxxx/demods/n/rate.Description: The number of output values sent to the computer per second.

/devxxxx/demods/n/trigger.Description: Sets the trigger- and gating-functionality of the demodulator., The triggers are configured by the bits of an integer. When multiple bits/triggers are set, they are or-ed. If trigger is set to 0 then demodulator data is sent continuously.

/devxxxx/demods/n/oscselect.Description: Index of the oscillator used to demodulate the signal.

/devxxxx/demods/n/harmonic.Description: The harmonic of the base frequency to be used., Selecting 1 chooses the fundamental frequency.

/devxxxx/demods/n/phaseshift.Description: The phase shift of the demodulator.

/devxxxx/demods/n/sinc.Description: Boolean value enabling Sinc filter functionality.

/devxxxx/demods/n/sample.Description: Samples of the demodulator are given out at this node.

/devxxxx/mods/n/freqdevenable.Description: In FM mode, enable peak deviation.

/devxxxx/mods/n/freqdev.Description: In FM mode, set peak deviation value.

/devxxxx/mods/n/index.Description: In FM mode, set modulation index value. The modulation index equals peak deviation divided by modulation frequency.

/devxxxx/mods/n/rate.Description: The number of output values sent to the computer per second.

/devxxxx/mods/n/trigger.Description: Sets the trigger- and gating-functionality of the demodulator.

/devxxxx/mods/n/carrier/inputselect.Description: Signal Input for the carrier demodulation.

/devxxxx/mods/n/carrier/timeconstant.Description: Sets the time constant of the carrier low-pass filter., The time constant is set for each stage of the low-pass filter. The total time constant and bandwidth depends on the selected order.

/devxxxx/mods/n/carrier/oscselect.Description: Index of the oscillator used to demodulate the signal.

/devxxxx/mods/n/carrier/harmonic.Description: Harmonic of the carrier frequency., Selecting 1 chooses the fundamental frequency.

/devxxxx/mods/n/carrier/phaseshift.Description: The phase shift of the carrier demodulator.

/devxxxx/mods/n/carrier/amplitude.Description: Carrier amplitude., Fraction of the output range added to the output signal., Multiply this value with the range setting to obtain voltage in V.

/devxxxx/mods/n/sidebands/n/inputselect.Description: Signal Input for the sideband demodulation.

/devxxxx/mods/n/sidebands/n/timeconstant.Description: Sets the time constant of the sideband low-pass filter., The time constant is set for each stage of the low-pass filter. The total time constant and bandwidth depends on the selected order.

/devxxxx/mods/n/sidebands/n/oscselect.Description: Index of the oscillator used to demodulate the signal.

/devxxxx/mods/n/sidebands/n/harmonic.Description: Harmonic of the sideband frequency., Selecting 1 chooses the fundamental frequency.

/devxxxx/mods/n/sidebands/n/phaseshift.Description: The phase shift of the sideband demodulator.

/devxxxx/mods/n/sidebands/n/amplitude.Description: Sideband amplitude, Fraction of the output range added to the output signal., Multiply this value with the range setting to obtain voltage in V.

/devxxxx/plls/n/adcselect.Description: Selects an input for the PLL.

/devxxxx/plls/n/freqrange.Description: Selects a frequency range for the PLL.

/devxxxx/plls/n/p.Description: Proportional gain of the PID controller.

/devxxxx/plls/n/i.Description: Integral gain of the PID controller.

/devxxxx/plls/n/adcthreshold.Description: Threshold for edge detection., Full scale corresponds to -4096 and 4095.

/devxxxx/plls/n/setpoint.Description: The setpoint in degrees of the PLL.

/devxxxx/plls/n/harmonic.Description: The harmonic of the base frequency to be used., Selecting 1 chooses the fundamental frequency.

/devxxxx/plls/n/order.Description: Selects the order of the low-pass filter.

/devxxxx/pids/n/input.Description: Selects the input for the PID.

/devxxxx/pids/n/inputchannel.Description: If applicable, selects the channel of the selected INPUT., Sets the input channel index for the selected INPUT, i.e., 0,1,2 etc.. The available channels depend on the input type.

/devxxxx/pids/n/output.Description: Selects the output for the PID.

/devxxxx/pids/n/outputchannel.Description: If applicable, selects the channel of the selected OUTPUT., Sets the input channel index for the selected OUTPUT, i.e., 0,1,2 etc.. The available channels depend on the output type

/devxxxx/pids/n/outputdefaultenable.Description: If OUTPUTDEFAULTENABLE is set, the value specified by OUTPUTDEFAULT will be applied when the PID is switched off.

/devxxxx/pids/n/outputdefault.Description: If OUTPUTDEFAULTENABLE is set, this node specifies the value to be applied.

/devxxxx/pids/n/p.Description: Proportional gain., Sets the proportional gain for the error signal. Negative feedback corresponds to a negative gain.

/devxxxx/pids/n/i.Description: Proportional gain for integrator., Sets the proportional gain for the integrated (accumulated) error signal. Negative feedback corresponds to a negative gain.

/devxxxx/pids/n/d.Description: Proportional gain for differentiator., Sets the proportional gain for the differentiated error signal. Negative feedback corresponds to a negative gain.

/devxxxx/pids/n/error.Description: Shows the error value., The calculated error is : ERROR = SETPOINT - IN.

/devxxxx/pids/n/range.Description: Sets the output range., The limits for the output are : OUT = [CENTER - RANGE,CENTER + RANGE] with RANGE > 0.0.

/devxxxx/pids/n/shift.Description: Shows the output shift., The calculated output value is : OUT = CENTER + SHIFT.

/devxxxx/pids/n/tipprotect/enable.Description: Enable TipProtect for the PID controller.

/devxxxx/pids/n/tipprotect/activetimecon.Description: Time constant when TipProtect is active., Time constant for low-pass filtering the PLL error² when TipProtect is active, i.e., when waiting to re-enable the PID controller.

/devxxxx/pids/n/tipprotect/activethresho.Description: Threshold for the active state., Threshold for PLL error² when TipProtect is active, i.e., when waiting to re-enable the PID controller.

/devxxxx/pids/n/tipprotect/inactivetimec.Description: Time constant when TipProtect is inactive., Time constant for low-pass filtering the PLL error² when TipProtect is inactive, i.e., when waiting to disable the PID controller.

/devxxxx/pids/n/tipprotect/inactivethres.Description: Threshold for the inactive state., Threshold for PLL error² when TipProtect is inactive, i.e., when waiting to disable the PID controller.

/devxxxx/pids/n/demod/adcselect.Description: Selects the index of the signal input for the demodulator.

/devxxxx/pids/n/demod/order.Description: Selects the order of the low-pass filter.

/devxxxx/pids/n/demod/timeconstant.Description: Sets the time constant of the low-pass filter., The time constant is set for each stage of the low-pass filter. The total time constant and bandwidth depends on the selected order.

/devxxxx/pids/n/demod/harmonic.Description: The harmonic of the base frequency to be used., Selecting 1 chooses the fundamental frequency.

/devxxxx/sigins/n/range.Description: Voltage range for the signal input.

/devxxxx/sigins/n/ac.Description: Boolean value setting for AC coupling of the Signal Input.

/devxxxx/sigins/n/imp50.Description: Boolean value enabling 50 Ohm input impedance termination.

/devxxxx/sigins/n/diff.Description: Boolean value switching differential input mode.

/devxxxx/sigouts/n/on.Description: Switches the output on and off.

/devxxxx/sigouts/n/add.Description: Switches the output adder on and off.

/devxxxx/sigouts/n/range.Description: Selects the output range for the Signal Output.

/devxxxx/sigouts/n/offset.Description: Offset added to the Signal Output., Multiply this value with the range setting to obtain offset voltage in V.

/devxxxx/sigouts/n/enables/n.Description: Switches a channel in the mixer on and off.

Options.2: Channel off (will be turned off on next change of sign from negative to positive)
Options.3: Channel on (will be turned on on next change of sign from negative to positive)

/devxxxx/sigouts/n/amplitudes/n.Description: Fraction of the output range added to the output signal., Multiply this value with the range setting to obtain voltage in V.

/devxxxx/sigouts/n/waveforms/n.Description:
Waveforms for a channel in the mixer., For hardware revisions 1.4 and lower, the
        output signal range for rectangular output is limited to 1 V.

/devxxxx/scopes/n/channel.Description: Selects the channel for which scope data should be provided.

/devxxxx/scopes/n/trigchannel.Description: Selects the channel which should be used as source for the scope's trigger.

/devxxxx/scopes/n/trigedge.Description: Selects whether the scope should trigger on rising or falling edge.

/devxxxx/scopes/n/triglevel.Description: Level at which a trigger is raised., Full scale is covered by min and max values

/devxxxx/scopes/n/trigholdoff.Description: Time to wait for re-arming the trigger after one occurred.

/devxxxx/scopes/n/time.Description:
Timescale of the scope wave (logarithmic decimation)., Determines the decimation of the sample
      rate. The following formulas apply: span = 2^val * 10 us, sample rate =
      210 MSamples/2^val

/devxxxx/dios/n/extclk.Description: Selects whether an external clock source should be used., The external clock needs to be applied to the DIO connector when this node is set to 1.

/devxxxx/dios/n/decimation.Description: Decimation for the sample rate of the DIO.

/devxxxx/dios/n/drive.Description: Selects if the outputs should be driven.

/devxxxx/dios/n/syncselect0.Description: Source to output the sync signal on bit 0.

/devxxxx/dios/n/syncselect1.Description: Source to output the sync signal on bit 1.

/devxxxx/auxouts/n/scale.Description: Scaling of the signal which is given out.

/devxxxx/auxouts/n/offset.Description: Value to be added to the output., The offset value is applied after scaling.

/devxxxx/cpus/n/program.Description: Node to write user programs to.

/devxxxx/cpus/n/output.Description: Node containing the standard output stream written by the real time program.

/devxxxx/zctrls/n/camp/available.Description: 1 when HF2CA is connected to the corresponding ZCtrl port.

/devxxxx/zctrls/n/camp/r.Description: Chooses a value for the shunt-resistor.

/devxxxx/zctrls/n/camp/dc.Description: Switches between AC coupling and DC coupling.

/devxxxx/zctrls/n/camp/singleended.Description: Switches between differential and single-ended input.

/devxxxx/zctrls/n/tamp/available.Description: 1 when HF2TA is connected to the corresponding ZCtrl port.

/devxxxx/zctrls/n/tamp/biasout.Description: Switches between internal and external bias.

/devxxxx/zctrls/n/tamp/n/currentgain.Description: Chooses a value for the current gain.

/devxxxx/zctrls/n/tamp/n/dc.Description: Switches between AC and DC Mode.

/devxxxx/zctrls/n/tamp/n/voltagegain.Description: Chooses a value for the voltage gain.
